CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 10, 1961, pg. A13, reads: "Notables at Victory Tea - the 17th annual tea given by the Victory Charity Club drew an amazingly large crowd, to fill Bethel AME Church. Two outstanding events occurred during the program. Mrs. Blanche Hensley, second from the right, won the crown of 'Mrs. Victory Charity Club,' by bringing in the magnificent some of $1, 246.70. Miss Martha Tyson, second from the left, was presented the Toki Schalk Johnson Citation for 1961, because of her numerous contributions to the community. Others shown are Mrs. Luvenia McKinney, left: Mrs. Constance Smith, center, general chairman of the day, and Mrs. Viola Sams, far right, founder-president of the club, who also was the first recipient of the TSJ award. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Luvenia McKinney, Martha Tyson, Constance Smith, Blanche Hensley and Viola Sams gathered for 17th annual Victory Tea in Bethel AME Church
